      • calculateEpipolarDistanceError

        public EpipolarTransformationFit calculateEpipolarDistanceError(no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix fm,
                                                                no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix leftPoints,
                                                                no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix rightPoints,
                                                                double threshhold)
        evaluate fit for the distances of each correspondence point to the epipolar line for it projected from it's pair in the other image. Luong et al. 1993, "On determining the fundamental matrix?: analysis of different methods and experimental results"
        Parameters:
        fm -
        leftPoints - points from left image in matrix of size 3 X nPoints. row 0 is x, row 1 is y, row 2 is all 1's
        rightPoints - points from right image in matrix of size 3 X nPoints. row 0 is x, row 1 is y, row 2 is all 1's
        threshhold -
        Returns:

        For use upon data that have been unit normal standardized. evaluate fit for already matched point lists
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • calculateEpipolarDistanceError2

        public EpipolarTransformationFit calculateEpipolarDistanceError2(no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix fm,
                                                                 no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix leftPoints,
                                                                 no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix rightPoints,
                                                                 double chiSquaredStatFactor)
        given the fundamental matrix solution and the correspondence pairs, use the Luong et al. 1993 distance for each correspondence pair as the closest distance of a point from the projected epipolar line of its pair. The standard deviation of the errors, and the chi-squared statistic factor are used to remove outliers and return the results. Luong et al. 1993, "On determining the fundamental matrix?: analysis of different methods and experimental results". NOTE: there may be other references for this method.
        Parameters:
        fm -
        leftPoints - points from left image in matrix of size 3 X nPoints. row 0 is x, row 1 is y, row 2 is all 1's
        rightPoints - points from right image in matrix of size 3 X nPoints. row 0 is x, row 1 is y, row 2 is all 1's
        chiSquaredStatFactor -
        Returns:

      • calculateRectificationErrors

        public static double calculateRectificationErrors(double[][] x1,
                                                  double[][] x2,
                                                  double[] outErrors,
                                                  gnu.trove.list.TIntList outInlierIndexes,
                                                  boolean useXToo)
        given rectified correspondence pairs in x1, x2, calculate the square root of the sum of squares of the differences in the y coordinates, or both x and y if useXToo is true. Also uses MAD or Tukey fences to determine inliers.
        Parameters:
        x1 - the image 1 set of correspondence points. format is 3 x N where N is the number of points. NOTE: since intrinsic parameters are not known, users of this method should presumably center the coordinates in some manner (e.g. subtract the image center or centroid of points) since internally an identity matrix is used for K.
        x2 - the image 2 set of correspondence points. format is 3 x N where N is the number of points. NOTE: since intrinsic parameters are not known, users of this method should presumably center the coordinates in some manner (e.g. subtract the image center or centroid of points).
        outErrors - array of length x1[0].length to be used to return each error as the square root of the sum of differences between each x1 and x2.
        outInlierIndexes - indexes of points which are within the robust statistics range for inliers (defined as not being outliers).
        useXToo - if true, the errors are not only the differences between the y coordinates of x1 and x2, but also the x-xoordinates of x1 and x2.
        Returns:
        square root of the sum of squared errors

      • calculateSampsonsError2

        public EpipolarTransformationFit calculateSampsonsError2(no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix fm,
                                                         no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix leftPoints,
                                                         no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix rightPoints,
                                                         double chiSquaredStatFactor)
        For use upon data that have been unit normal standardized. given the fundamental matrix solution and the correspondence pairs, use the Sampson distance as an error for each correspondence pair, then use the standard deviation of the errors, and the chi-squared statistic factor to remove outliers and return the results.
        Parameters:
        fm -
        leftPoints - points from left image in matrix of size 3 X nPoints. row 0 is x, row 1 is y, row 2 is all 1's
        rightPoints - points from right image in matrix of size 3 X nPoints. row 0 is x, row 1 is y, row 2 is all 1's
        chiSquaredStatFactor -
        Returns:

      • calculateDistancesFromEpipolar

        public double[][] calculateDistancesFromEpipolar(no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix fm,
                                                 no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix matchedLeftPoints,
                                                 no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix matchedRightPoints)
        find the distance of the given points from their respective projected epipolar lines. Luong et al. 1993, "On determining the fundamental matrix?: analysis of different methods and experimental results"
        Parameters:
        fm -
        matchedLeftPoints - points from left image in matrix of size 3 X nPoints. row 0 is x, row 1 is y, row 2 is all 1's
        matchedRightPoints - points from right image in matrix of size 3 X nPoints. row 0 is x, row 1 is y, row 2 is all 1's
        Returns:
        array of size[2][matchedLeftPoints.numColumns()]

      • calculateEpipolarSampsonsDistanceSquared

        public double[] calculateEpipolarSampsonsDistanceSquared(no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix fm,
                                                         no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix x1,
                                                         no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix x2)
        For use upon data that have been unit normal standardized. Sampson's distance measures the distance between a correspondence pair and its Sampson correction (Torr and Zissermann, 1997). Torr & Murray 1997 describe the Sampson distance further: "it represents the sum of squares of the algebraic residuals divided by their standard deviations" and provides a first order fit to the Kendall & Stuart (1983) minimization of the orthogonal distance of each point to a curve/surface of the maximum likelihood solution. perpendicular geometric distances... 
             implemented from eqn 11 from Fathy, Husseina, & Tolbaa, 2017
     "Fundamental Matrix Estimation: A Study of Error Criteria"
     https://arxiv.org/pdf/1706.07886.pdf
     which references Torr and Zisserman 1997, 
     Machine Vision and Applications 9 (5), 321–333,
     " Performance characterization of fundamental matrix estimation under image 
     degradation"
        Parameters:
        fm -
        x1 - points from left image in matrix of size 3 X nPoints. row 0 is x, row 1 is y, row 2 is all 1's
        x2 - points from right image in matrix of size 3 X nPoints. row 0 is x, row 1 is y, row 2 is all 1's
        Returns:
        double array of length [n]

      • calculatePerpDistFromLines

        public void calculatePerpDistFromLines(no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix u1,
                                       no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix u2,
                                       no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix fu1,
                                       no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix fTu2,
                                       int leftIdx,
                                       int rightIdx,
                                       float[] output)
        Parameters:
        u1 - points from left image in matrix of size 3 X nPoints. row 0 is x, row 1 is y, row 2 is all 1's
        u2 - points from right image in matrix of size 3 X nPoints. row 0 is x, row 1 is y, row 2 is all 1's
        fu1 -
        fTu2 -
        leftIdx -
        rightIdx -
        output - an output variable to hold as element 0, the distance of the right image point at rightIdx from from it's left epipolar line projected into the right image. element 1 holds the reverse for the left image point at leftIdx.
